definitions.definition: a destructive wave of highly compressed air spreading outward from an explosion.
examples: they were thrown backward by the blast
synonyms: pressure wave "the blast from the bomb"

definitions.definition: an explosion or explosive firing, especially of a bomb.
examples: a bomb blast

definitions.definition: a forceful attack or assault.
examples: he defeated his weakest opponent in such a blast that the fans left unimpressed

definitions.definition: a strong gust of wind or air.
examples: the icy blast hit them
synonyms: puff "a sudden blast of cold air"

definitions.definition: a strong current of air used in smelting.
a single loud note of a horn, whistle, or other noisemaking device.
examples: a blast of the ship's siren
synonyms: beep "the shrill blast of the trumpets"

definitions.definition: a severe reprimand.
examples: I braced myself for the inevitable blast

definitions.definition: an enjoyable experience or lively party.
examples: it could turn out to be a real blast

definitions.definition: blow up or break apart (something solid) with explosives.
examples: quantities of solid rock had to be blasted away

definitions.definition: produce (damage or a hole) by means of an explosion.
examples: the force of the collision blasted out a tremendous crater

definitions.definition: force or throw (something) in a specified direction by impact or explosion.
examples: the car was blasted thirty feet into the sky

definitions.definition: shoot with a gun.
examples: Fowler was blasted with an air rifle

definitions.definition: move very quickly and loudly in a specified direction.
examples: driving rain blasted through the smashed window

definitions.definition: criticize fiercely.
examples: the school was blasted by government inspectors

definitions.definition: make or cause to make a loud continuous musical or other noise.
examples: music blasted out at full volume

definitions.definition: kick, strike, or throw (a ball) hard.
examples: Ripken blasted the ball into the gap in right field

definitions.definition: (of a wind or other natural force) wither, shrivel, or blight (a plant).
examples: crops blasted on the eve of harvest

definitions.definition: strike with divine anger.
examples: damn and blast this awful place!

definitions.definition: destroy or ruin.
examples: a candidate whose only strategy is to blast the opposition

definitions.definition: expressing annoyance.
examples: “Blast! The car won't start!”

definitions.definition: denoting an embryonic cell.
examples: erythroblast

definitions.definition: denoting a germ layer of an embryo.
examples: epiblast
